organic.title: Heart attack - Symptoms & causes - Mayo Clinic
organic.snippet: A heart attack occurs when the flow of blood to the heart is severely reduced or blocked. The blockage is usually due to a buildup of fat, cholesterol and ...

organic.title: Causes of heart attack - NHS
organic.snippet: Heart attacks are caused by the blood supply to the heart being suddenly interrupted. Without this supply, heart muscles may be damaged and begin to die.

organic.title: Heart Attack: Symptoms & Treatment - Cleveland Clinic
organic.snippet: Most heart attacks happen because of a blockage in one of the blood vessels that supply your heart. Most often, this occurs because of plaque, a sticky ...

organic.title: Heart Attack - Causes and Risk Factors | NHLBI, NIH
organic.snippet: The most common cause of a heart attack is coronary artery disease, which is the most common type of heart disease.

organic.title: About Heart Attack Symptoms, Risk, and Recovery - CDC
organic.snippet: Coronary artery disease (CAD) is the main cause of heart attack. A less common cause is a severe spasm, or sudden contraction, of a coronary ...

organic.title: Heart attack - NHS
organic.snippet: Causes of a heart attack. Coronary heart disease (CHD) is the leading cause of heart attacks. CHD is a condition in which the major blood vessels ...

organic.title: Heart Attack | Myocardial Infarction - MedlinePlus
organic.snippet: A heart attack happens when blood flow to the heart suddenly becomes blocked. Without the blood coming in, the heart can't get oxygen.

organic.title: Heart Attack: Symptoms & Causes | NewYork-Presbyterian
organic.snippet: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart stops or is severely reduced, usually due to a blockage in the coronary arteries.

organic.title: What does a heart attack feel like: symptoms and warning signs • HRI
organic.snippet: A heart attack occurs when the heart is deprived of oxygen due to a blockage in one of the coronary arteries that supplies blood to the heart.

people_also_ask.question: How to reduce chances of heart attack?
people_also_ask.snippet:
STRATEGIES TO PREVENT HEART DISEASE
1
Don't smoke or use tobacco. ...
2
Get moving: Aim for at least 30 to 60 minutes of activity daily. ...
3
Eat a heart-healthy diet. ...
4
Maintain a healthy weight. ...
5
Get quality sleep. ...
6
Manage stress. ...
7
Get regular health screening tests. ...
8
Take steps to prevent infections.
people_also_ask.title: Strategies to prevent heart disease - Mayo Clinic

people_also_ask.question: What is the 7 second trick to prevent heart attack?
people_also_ask.snippet: The “7-second trick” is a simple deep-breathing technique that helps reduce stress- a key trigger for heart attacks in young adults. Breathe in for 4 seconds, hold briefly, and exhale slowly over 3 seconds. If practiced daily for 15mins, it calms the nervous system, lowers blood pressure, and supports heart health.
people_also_ask.title: Heart Attack in Young Adults: Causes & 7-Second Prevention Tip
